## Loading Chat

Turns out there's a handy dandy package called rwhatsapp that wrangles the exported text file data for you! The dyplr package includes the basic data manipulation functions we need.

```{r cars, message=FALSE}
library(rwhatsapp)
library(dplyr)
library(stringr)
library(gridExtra)
```

replace for loops with purrr
map_dfr


```{r, warning=FALSE}
files <- tibble(fn = dir()) %>% 
    filter(str_detect(fn, '.txt$'))

first <- TRUE

for (file in files$fn){
  chat <- rwa_read(file) %>% 
    filter(!is.na(author)) # remove messages without author
  if(first){
    chats <- chat
    first <- FALSE
  }else{
    chats <- bind_rows(chats, chat) %>% 
      filter(!str_detect(author,"[0-9]"),
             !str_detect(author,"Darren Dawson"))
  }
}
```


The Herd uses Whatsapp like a forum with each chat having a different topic. For now we'll look at data from the past year in just the main chat.

## Plots

Here's a quick one that plots the total messages per day:

```{r, message=FALSE}
library("ggplot2"); theme_set(theme_minimal())
library("lubridate")
chats %>%
  mutate(day = date(time)) %>%
  count(day) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = day, y = n)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  ylab("") + xlab("") +
  ggtitle("Messages per day")
```



This shows the total messages each person has sent

```{r}
chats %>%
  mutate(day = date(time)) %>%
  count(author) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(author, n), y = n)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  ylab("") + xlab("") +
  coord_flip() +
  ggtitle("Number of messages") 
  
```
```{r}
chats %>%
  count(author,source) %>%
  group_by(author) %>% 
  mutate(total = sum(n)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(author, total), y = n, fill=source)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  ylab("") + xlab("") +
  coord_flip() +
  ggtitle("Number of messages") 
  
```



The most commonly used emojis for each person
```{r}
library("tidyr")
chats %>%
  unnest(emoji) %>%
  count(author, emoji, sort = TRUE) %>%
  group_by(author) %>%
  top_n(n = 6, n) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(emoji, n), y = n, fill = author)) +
  geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +
  ylab("") +
  xlab("") +
  coord_flip() +
  facet_wrap(~author, ncol = 2, scales = "free_y")  +
  ggtitle("Emojis")
```



Most commonly used words excluding "stopwords" and using inverse document frequency (tfâ€“idf) to find words that are common within the messages of one author but uncommon in the rest of the messages.
```{r}
library("tidytext")
library("stopwords")
to_remove <- c(stopwords(language = "en"),
               "media",
               "omitted")

chats %>%
  unnest_tokens(input = text,
                output = word) %>%
  select(word, author) %>%
  filter(!word %in% to_remove) %>%
  mutate(word = gsub(".com", "", word)) %>%
  mutate(word = gsub("^gag", "9gag", word)) %>%
  count(author, word, sort = TRUE) %>%
  bind_tf_idf(term = word, document = author, n = n) %>%
  filter(n > 10) %>%
  group_by(author) %>%
  top_n(n = 6, tf_idf) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder_within(word, n, author), y = n, fill = author)) +
  geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +
  ylab("") +
  xlab("") +
  coord_flip() +
  facet_wrap(~author, ncol = 2, scales = "free_y") +
  scale_x_reordered() +
  ggtitle("Common words using tf-idf")
```


Number of unique words used
```{r}
chats %>%
  unnest_tokens(input = text,
                output = word) %>%
  filter(!word %in% to_remove) %>%
  group_by(author) %>%
  summarise(lex_diversity = n_distinct(word)) %>%
  arrange(desc(lex_diversity)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(author, lex_diversity),
                          y = lex_diversity,
                          fill = author)) +
  geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = (mult = c(0, 0, 0, 500))) +
  geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(lex_diversity)), hjust = -0.1) +
  ylab("unique words") +
  xlab("") +
  ggtitle("Lexical Diversity") +
  coord_flip()
```



Top 3 unique words by each person
```{r}
authors <- unique(chats$author)
aplots <- list()


for(author in authors){
  o_words <- chat %>%
    unnest_tokens(input = text,
                  output = word) %>%
    filter(author != author) %>% 
    count(word, sort = TRUE) 
  
  aplot <- chats %>%
    unnest_tokens(input = text,
                  output = word) %>%
    filter(author == author) %>% 
    count(word, sort = TRUE) %>% 
    filter(!word %in% o_words$word) %>% # only select words nobody else uses
    top_n(n = 3, n) %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = reorder(word, n), y = n)) +
    geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +
    ylab("") + xlab("") +
    coord_flip() +
    ggtitle(sprintf("Unique words from %s", author ))
  
  aplots[[author]] <- aplot
}
grid.arrange(grobs=aplots,ncol=3)
```
